page.title: 18READING, VIEWING & LISTENING
page.content: NEWSPAPERS These,along with a limited variety of magazines, are available from the Deanston shop or may be collected outwith the area. Sunday papers are similarly available and can be ordered from the shop for delivery within the village. Local news may be read in the Friday (local) edition of the Stirling Observer, price 20 pence. MOBILE LIBRARY The District provide a bi-weekly service at the school & at 3 stops for the elderly of the village. TELEVISION & VIDEOS Television sets are used in most homes for national news, information and entertainment. Video players are used in many homes for showing hired films. Schools use television for educational programmes. RADIO.Sound radio still proves popular especially with those living alone. PERSONAL CASSETTE PLAYERS are very popular, especially with young people.
